Chapter 1 . In the corner of [a firstclass smoking carriage]180-a firstclass smoking carriage , [Mr. Justice Wargrave]55-mr. justice wargrave , lately retired from the bench , puffed at a cigar and ran an interested eye through the political news in the Times . [He]55-mr. justice wargrave laid the paper down and glanced out of the window . [They]181-they were running now through [Somerset]1-somerset . [He]55-mr. justice wargrave glanced at [his]55-mr. justice wargrave watch another two hours to go . [He]55-mr. justice wargrave went over in [his]55-mr. justice wargrave mind all that had appeared in the papers about [Indian Island]2-indian island . [Rogers]94-rogers went round with the coffee tray . The coffee was good really black and very hot . [The whole party]577-the whole party had dined well . [They]577-the whole party were satisfied with [themselves]577-the whole party and with life . The hands of the clock pointed to twenty minutes past nine . There was a silence a comfortable replete silence . Into that silence came [The Voice]106-the voice . Without warning , inhuman , penetrating ... " [Ladies and gentlemen]1999-ladies and gentlemen ! [The Voice]106-the voice went on a high clear voice . [You]580-you are charged with the following indictments : [Edward George Armstrong]84-armstrong , that [you]580-you did upon the 14th day of March , 1925 , cause the death of [Louisa Mary Clees]107-clees . [Emily Caroline Brent]108-emily caroline brent , that upon the 5th November , 1931 , [you]580-you were responsible for the death of [Beatrice Taylor]109-beatrice taylor . [Anthony James Marston]92-anthony marston , that upon the 14th day of November last , [you]580-you were guilty of the murder of [John]112-john gordon macarthur and [Lucy Combes]114-lucy combes . [Thomas Rogers]115-thomas rogers and [Ethel Rogers]116-ethel rogers , that on the 6th of May , 1929 , [you]580-you brought about the death of [Jennifer Brady]117-jennifer brady . [Lawrence John Wargrave]118-john , that upon the 10th day of June , 1930 , [you]580-you were guilty of the murder of [Edward Seton]119-seton . Prisoners at [the bar]585-the bar , have [you]580-you anything to say in [your]580-you defence ? The Voice had stopped . There was a moment 's petrified silence and then a resounding crash ! [Rogers]94-rogers had dropped the coffee tray ! At the same moment , from somewhere outside [the room]468-the room there came a scream and the sound of a thud . [Lombard]71-lombard was the first to move . [He]71-lombard leapt to the door and flung it open . Outside , lying in a huddled mass , was [Mrs. Rogers]94-rogers . "[141-armitage] Tomorrow , of course , when [the motor boat]554-the motor boat came from [the mainland]555-the mainland . To go back to [the mainland]555-the mainland , back to [[his]141-armitage little house]850-his little house , back to all the troubles and worries . Through the open window [he]141-armitage could hear the waves breaking on the rocks a little louder now than earlier in the evening . Wind was getting up , too . [He]141-armitage thought : " [Peaceful sound]2096-peaceful sound . [Peaceful place]2097-peaceful place ... "[141-armitage] [He]141-armitage thought : " Best of [an island]205-an island is once [you]2099-you get [there]193-there [you]2099-you ca n't go any further ... [you]2099-you 've come to the end of things ... "[141-armitage] [He]141-armitage knew , suddenly , that [he]141-armitage did n't want to leave [the island]1934-the island . "[71-lombard] [He]71-lombard took up the empty bacon dish and went out . Again there was silence . ( [[His]80-general macarthur cousin]2527-his cousin married [Elsie MacPherson]159-elsie macpherson . ) There is no doubt but that [he]80-general macarthur was murdered . [Dr. Armstrong]86-armstrong told a humorous story . [Mr. Justice Wargrave]55-mr. justice wargrave , who ordinarily hated tea , sipped approvingly . [He]1195-he said nervously and at random : " Excuse [me]1195-he , [sir]1891-sir , but does [any one]730-any one know what 's become of the bathroom curtain ? "[71-lombard] Chapter 11 . [Philip Lombard]71-lombard had the habit of waking at daybreak . [He]71-lombard did so on this particular morning . [He]71-lombard raised [himself]71-lombard on an elbow and listened . The wind had somewhat abated but was still blowing . [He]71-lombard could hear no sound of rain ... At eight o'clock the wind was blowing more strongly , but [Lombard]71-lombard did not hear it . [He]71-lombard was asleep again . Chapter 13 . " [One of [us]1326-us]2004-one of us ... [One of [us]1326-us]2004-one of us ... [One of [us]1326-us]2004-one of us ... "[1331-five frightened people] Three words , endlessly repeated , dinning themselves hour after hour into receptive brains . [Five people]1330-five people [five frightened people]1331-five frightened people . [Five people who watched each other]1332-five people who watched each other , who now hardly troubled to hide [their]1332-five people who watched each other state of nervous tension . [They]1330-five people were [five enemies linked together by a mutual instinct of selfpreservation]1333-five enemies linked together by a mutual instinct of selfpreservation . And all of [them]1330-five people , suddenly , looked less like [human beings]1334-human beings . [They]1330-five people were reverted to more bestial types . Like a wary old tortoise , [Mr. Justice Wargrave]55-mr. justice wargrave sat hunched up , [his]55-mr. justice wargrave body motionless , [his]55-mr. justice wargrave eyes keen and alert . [Ex - Inspector Blore]157-blore looked coarser and clumsier in build . [His]157-blore walk was that of a slow padding animal . [His]157-blore eyes were bloodshot . There was a look of mingled ferocity and stupidity about [him]157-blore . [He]157-blore was like a beast at bay ready to charge its pursuers . [Philip Lombard]71-lombard 's senses seemed heightened , rather than diminished . [His]71-lombard ears reacted to the slightest sound . [His]71-lombard step was lighter and quicker , [his]71-lombard body was lithe and graceful . And [he]71-lombard smiled often , [his]71-lombard lips curling back from [his]71-lombard long white teeth . [Vera Claythorne]125-vera was very quiet . [She]125-vera sat most of the time huddled in a chair . [Her]125-vera eyes stared ahead of [her]125-vera into space . [She]125-vera looked dazed . [She]125-vera was like a bird that has dashed its head against glass and that has been picked up by a human hand . It crouches there , terrified , unable to move , hoping to save itself by its immobility . [Armstrong]86-armstrong was in a pitiable condition of nerves . [He]86-armstrong twitched and [his]86-armstrong hands shook . [He]86-armstrong lighted cigarette after cigarette and stubbed them out almost immediately . The forced inaction of [their]1335-we position seemed to gall [him]86-armstrong more than the others . Every now and then [he]86-armstrong broke out into a torrent of nervous speech . " [We]1335-we [we]1335-we should n't just sit here doing nothing ! There must be something surely , surely , there is something that [we]1335-we can do ? In the silence [he]93-blore could hear the clocks strike [downstairs]771-downstairs . Midnight . [He]93-blore relaxed a little now even went so far as to lie down on [his]93-blore bed . But [he]93-blore did not undress . [He]93-blore lay there , thinking . Going over the whole business from the beginning , methodically , painstakingly , as [he]93-blore had been wo nt to do in [[his]93-blore police officer]2754-his police officer days . It was thoroughness that paid in the end . The candle was burning down . Looking to see if the matches were within easy reach of [his]93-blore hand , [he]93-blore blew it out . Strangely enough , [he]93-blore found the darkness disquieting . It was as though a thousand ageold fears awoke and struggled for supremacy in [his]93-blore brain . [Faces]165-faces floated in the air [the judge]338-the judge 's face crowned with that mockery of grey wool the cold dead face of [Mrs. Rogers]94-rogers the convulsed purple face of [Anthony Marston]92-anthony marston ... No , much longer ago than that . Funny , that [he]93-blore could n't put a name to it ... Silly sort of face [really fellow]2757-really fellow looked a bit of a mug . Of course ! It came to [him]93-blore with a real shock . [Landor]111-landor ! Odd to think [he]93-blore 'd completely forgotten what [Landor]111-landor looked like . Only yesterday [he]93-blore 'd been trying to recall [the fellow]685-the fellow 's face , and had n't been able to . And now here it was , every feature clear and distinct , as though [he]93-blore had seen it only yesterday ... [Landor]111-landor had had [a wife]2759-a wife a thin slip of [a woman with a worried face]2760-a woman with a worried face . [He]93-blore did n't understand this revolver business ... [Somebody in [the house]189-the house]2764-somebody in the house had got that revolver ... Downstairs a clock struck one . [Blore]93-blore 's thoughts were cut short . [He]93-blore sat up on the bed , suddenly alert . For [he]93-blore had heard a sound a very faint sound somewhere outside [his]93-blore bedroom door . There was [some one]608-some one moving about in [the darkened house]2767-the darkened house . The perspiration broke out on [his]93-blore forehead . Who was it , moving secretly and silently along [the corridors]2768-the corridors ? [Some one who was up to no good]2769-some one who was up to no good , [he]93-blore 'd bet that ! Noiselessly , in spite of [his]93-blore heavy build , [he]93-blore dropped off the bed and with two strides was standing by the door listening . But the sound did not come again . [Nevertheless Blore]93-blore was convinced that [he]93-blore was not mistaken . [He]93-blore had heard a footfall just outside [his]93-blore door . The hair rose slightly on [his]93-blore scalp . [He]93-blore knew fear again ... [Some one creeping about stealthily in the night]2770-some one creeping about stealthily in the night ... [He]93-blore listened but the sound was not repeated . And now a new temptation assailed [him]93-blore . [He]93-blore wanted , desperately , to go out and investigate . If [he]93-blore could only see who it was prowling about in the darkness . But to open [his]93-blore door would be the action of [a fool]2702-a fool . Very likely that was exactly what [the other]1210-the other was waiting for . [He]93-blore might even have meant [Blore]93-blore to hear what [he]93-blore had heard , counting on [him]93-blore coming out to investigate . [Blore]93-blore stood rigid , listening . [He]93-blore could hear sounds everywhere now , cracks , rustles , mysterious whispers but [his]93-blore dogged realistic brain knew them for what they were the creations of [his]93-blore own heated imagination . And then suddenly [he]93-blore heard something that was not imagination . [They]2774-they came softly along [the corridor]1304-the corridor ( both [[Lombard]71-lombard 's and [Armstrong]86-armstrong 's rooms]2776-lombard 's and armstrong 's rooms were farther from the stairhead than [his]93-blore ) . [They]2774-they passed [his]93-blore door without hesitating or faltering . And as [they]2774-they did so , [Blore]93-blore made up [his]93-blore mind . [He]93-blore meant to see who it was ! The footsteps had definitely passed [his]93-blore door going to [the stairs]1221-the stairs . Where was [the man]557-the man going ? When [Blore]93-blore acted , [he]93-blore acted quickly , surprisingly so for [a man who looked so heavy and slow]2779-a man who looked so heavy and slow . [He]93-blore tiptoed back to the bed , slipped matches into [his]93-blore pocket , detached the plug of the electric lamp by [his]93-blore bed , and picked it up winding the flex round it . It was a chromium affair with a heavy ebonite base a useful weapon . [He]93-blore sprinted noiselessly across [the room]468-the room , removed the chair from under the door handle and with precaution unlocked and unbolted the door . [He]93-blore stepped out into [the corridor]1304-the corridor . There was a faint sound in [the hall below]2782-the hall below ; [Blore]93-blore ran noiselessly in [his]93-blore stockinged feet to the head of the stairs . At that moment [he]93-blore realized why it was [he]93-blore had heard all these sounds so clearly . The wind had died down completely and the sky must have cleared . There was faint moonlight coming in through the landing window and it illuminated [the hall]1966-the hall below . [Blore]93-blore had an instantaneous glimpse of [a figure just passing out through the front door]2784-a figure just passing out through the front door . In the act of running down the stairs in pursuit , [he]93-blore paused . Once again , [he]93-blore had nearly made a fool of [himself]93-blore ! [His]93-blore face changed . [Philip Lombard]71-lombard saw it . [He]0-i said impatiently : "[0-i] Do n't be [a damned fool]1437-a damned fool , [Blore]93-blore ! " [He]0-i started off into the moonlight . [Blore]93-blore , after a minute 's hesitation , followed [him]0-i . [He]93-blore thought to [himself]93-blore : "[0-i] [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i 'm asking for it . But after all " After all [he]93-blore had tackled [criminals armed with revolvers before now]2795-criminals armed with revolvers before now . Whatever else [he]93-blore lacked , [Blore]93-blore did not lack courage . Show [him]93-blore the danger and [he]93-blore would tackle it pluckily . [He]93-blore was not afraid of danger in the open , only of danger undefined and tinged with the supernatural . [Vera]125-vera , left to wait results , got up and dressed . [She]125-vera glanced over once or twice at the door . It was a good solid door . It was both bolted and locked and had an oak chair wedged under the handle . [It]2796-it could not be broken open by force . Certainly not by [Dr. Armstrong]86-armstrong . [He]86-armstrong was not [a physically powerful man]2797-a physically powerful man . If [she]125-vera were [Armstrong]86-armstrong intent on murder , it was cunning that [she]125-vera would employ , not force . [She]125-vera amused [herself]125-vera by reflecting on the means [he]86-armstrong might employ . [He]86-armstrong might , as [Philip]71-lombard had suggested , announce that [one of [the other two men]2799-the other two men]2798-one of the other two men was dead . Or [he]86-armstrong might possibly pretend to be mortally wounded [himself]86-armstrong , might drag [himself]86-armstrong groaning to [her]125-vera door . There were other possibilities . [He]86-armstrong might inform [her]125-vera that [the house]189-the house was on fire . More , [he]86-armstrong might actually set [the house]189-the house on fire ... Yes , that would be a possibility . Lure [the other two men]2799-the other two men out of [the house]189-the house , then , having previously laid a trail of petrol , [he]86-armstrong might set light to it . And [she]125-vera , like [an idiot]2804-an idiot , would remain barricaded in [[her]125-vera room]2444-her room until it was too late . [She]125-vera crossed over to the window . Not too bad . At a pinch [one]270-one could escape that way . It would mean a drop but there was a handy flowerbed . [She]125-vera sat down and picking up [her]125-vera diary began to write in it in a clear flowing hand . [One]270-one must pass the time . Suddenly [she]125-vera stiffened to attention . [She]125-vera had heard a sound . It was , [she]125-vera thought , a sound like breaking glass . And it came from somewhere [downstairs]771-downstairs . [She]125-vera listened hard , but the sound was not repeated . [She]125-vera heard , or thought [she]125-vera heard , stealthy sounds of footsteps , the creak of stairs , the rustle of garments but there was nothing definite , and [she]125-vera concluded , as [Blore]93-blore had done earlier , that such sounds had their origin in [her]125-vera own imagination . But presently [she]125-vera heard sounds of a more concrete nature . [People]1846-people moving about [downstairs]771-downstairs the murmur of voices . Then the very decided sound of [some one mounting the stairs]2811-some one mounting the stairs doors opening and shutting feet going up to the attics overhead . More noises from there . A pane in the diningroom window has been smashed and there are only [three little Indian boys]496-three little indian boys on the table . " Chapter 15 . [Three people]365-three people sat eating breakfast in [the kitchen]1243-the kitchen . Outside , the sun shone . It was a lovely day . The storm was a thing of the past . [They]365-three people felt now like [people just awakening from a nightmare]2818-people just awakening from a nightmare . There was danger , yet , but it was danger in daylight . But there was no need of caution . [Philip Lombard]71-lombard was dead shot through the heart ... Relief possessed [Vera]125-vera enormous exquisite relief . At last it was over . There was no more fear no more steeling of [her]125-vera nerves ... [She]125-vera was alone on [the island]1934-the island ... Alone with [nine dead bodies]2844-nine dead bodies ... But what did that matter ? [She]125-vera was alive ... [She]125-vera sat there exquisitely happy exquisitely at peace ... No more fear ... The sun was setting when [Vera]125-vera moved at last . [Sheer]169-sheer reaction had kept [her]125-vera immobile . There had been no room in [her]125-vera for anything but the glorious sense of safety . [She]125-vera had conquered had triumphed over the most deadly peril . By [her]125-vera own quickwittedness and adroitness [she]125-vera had turned the tables on [her]125-vera wouldbe destroyer . [Epilogue]172-epilogue . [Sir Thomas Legge]173-sir thomas legge , [Assistant Commissioner at [Scotland Yard]47-scotland yard]2866-assistant commissioner at scotland yard , said irritably : "[69-cyril] But the whole thing 's incredible ! " [Inspector Maine]174-maine said respectfully : "[0-i] [I]0-i know , [sir]1891-sir . "[2871-the assistant commissioner] A MANUSCRIPT DOCUMENT SENT TO [SCOTLAND]51-scotland YARD BY THE MASTER OF [THE EMMA JANE]177-the emma jane , [FISHING TRAWLER]1674-fishing trawler . From [my]0-i earliest youth [I]0-i realized that [my]0-i nature was a mass of contradictions . [I]0-i have to begin with , an incurably romantic imagination . The practice of throwing a bottle into the sea with an important document inside was one that never failed to thrill [me]0-i when reading adventure stories as [a child]837-a child . It thrills [me]0-i still and for that reason [I]0-i have adopted this course writing [my]0-i confession , enclosing it in a bottle , sealing the latter , and casting it into the waves . There is , [I]0-i suppose , a hundred to one chance that [my]0-i confession may be found and then ( or do [I]0-i flatter [myself]0-i ! ) a hitherto unsolved murder mystery will be explained . [I]0-i was born with other traits besides [my]0-i romantic fancy . [I]0-i have a definite sadistic delight in seeing or causing death . [I]0-i remember experiments with wasps with various garden pests ... From an early age [I]0-i knew very strongly the lust to kill . But side by side with this went a contradictory trait a strong sense of justice . It is abhorrent to [me]0-i that [an innocent person]1676-an innocent person or creature should suffer or die by any act of [mine]0-i . [I]0-i have always felt strongly that right should prevail . It may be understood [I]0-i think [a psychologist]1677-a psychologist would understand that with [my]0-i mental makeup being what it was , [I]0-i adopted the law as a profession . The legal profession satisfied nearly all [my]0-i instincts . Crime and its punishment has always fascinated [me]0-i . [I]0-i enjoy reading every kind of detective story and thriller . [I]0-i have devised for [my]0-i own private amusement the most ingenious ways of carrying out a murder . When in due course [I]0-i came to preside over a court of law , that other secret instinct of [mine]0-i was encouraged to develop . To see [a wretched criminal squirming in the dock]1678-a wretched criminal squirming in the dock , suffering the tortures of [the damned]1679-the damned , as [his]1678-a wretched criminal squirming in the dock doom came slowly and slowly nearer , was to [me]0-i an exquisite pleasure . Mind [you]1680-you , [I]0-i took no pleasure in seeing [an innocent man there]1681-an innocent man there . On at least two occasions [I]0-i stopped cases where to [my]0-i mind [the accused]1682-the accused was palpably innocent , directing [the jury that there was no case]1683-the jury that there was no case . [I]0-i must [I]0-i must [I]0-i must commit a murder ! And what is more , it must be no ordinary murder ! It must be a fantastical crime something stupendous out of the common ! [The innocent]1700-the innocent must not suffer . And then , quite suddenly , the idea came to [me]0-i started by a chance remark uttered during casual conversation . [I]0-i shut the window and later [I]0-i broke the glass . Then [I]0-i went [upstairs]463-upstairs and laid [myself]0-i out again on [my]0-i bed . [I]0-i calculated that [they]1804-they would search [the house]189-the house again , but [I]0-i did not think [they]1804-they would look closely at any of the corpses , a mere twitch aside of the sheet to satisfy [themselves]1804-they that it was not [Armstrong]86-armstrong masquerading as a body . This is exactly what occurred . [I]0-i forgot to say that [I]0-i returned the revolver to [[Lombard]71-lombard 's room]1305-lombard 's room . It may be of interest to [some one]608-some one to know where it was hidden during the search . There was a big pile of tinned food in the larder . [I]0-i opened the bottom most of the tins biscuits [I]0-i think it contained , bedded in the revolver and replaced the strip of adhesive tape . [I]0-i calculated , and rightly , that [no one]2220-no one would think of working [their]1804-they way through a pile of apparently untouched foodstuffs , especially as all the top tins were soldered . The red curtain [I]0-i had concealed by laying it flat on the seat of one of the drawingroom chairs under the chintz cover and the wool in the seat cushion , cutting a small hole . And now came the moment that [I]0-i had anticipated [three people who were so frightened of each other that anything might happen and one of [them]1811-three people who were so frightened of each other that anything might happen and one of them]1811-three people who were so frightened of each other that anything might happen and one of them had a revolver . [I]0-i watched [them]1811-three people who were so frightened of each other that anything might happen and one of them from the windows of [the house]189-the house . When [Blore]157-blore came up alone [I]0-i had the big marble clock poised ready . Exit [Blore]157-blore ... From [my]0-i window [I]0-i saw [Vera Claythorne]125-vera shoot [Lombard]71-lombard . [A daring and resourceful young woman]1813-a daring and resourceful young woman . [I]0-i always thought [she]125-vera was a match for [him]71-lombard and more . As soon as that had happened [I]0-i set the stage in [[her]125-vera bedroom]561-her bedroom . It was an interesting psychological experiment . Would the consciousness of [her]125-vera own guilt , the state of nervous tension consequent on having just shot [a man]1874-a man , be sufficient , together with the hypnotic suggestion of the surroundings , to cause [her]125-vera to take [her]125-vera own life ? [I]0-i thought it would . [I]0-i was right . [Vera Claythorne]125-vera hanged [herself]125-vera before [my]0-i eyes where [I]0-i stood in the shadow of [the wardrobe]1816-the wardrobe . And now for the last stage . [I]0-i came forward , picked up the chair and set it against the wall . [I]0-i looked for the revolver and found it at the top of the stairs where [the girl]224-the girl had dropped it [I]0-i was careful to preserve [her]125-vera fingerprints on it . And now ? [I]0-i shall finish writing this . [I]0-i shall enclose it and seal it in a bottle and [I]0-i shall throw the bottle into [the sea]209-the sea . Why ? Yes , why ? ... It was [my]0-i ambition to invent a murder mystery that [no one]2220-no one could solve . But [no artist]1820-no artist , [I]0-i now realize , can be satisfied with art alone . There is a natural craving for recognition which can not be gainsaid . [I]0-i have , let [me]0-i confess it in all humility , a pitiful human wish that [some one]608-some one should know just how clever [I]0-i have been ... In all this , [I]0-i have assumed that the mystery of [Indian Island]2-indian island will remain unsolved . It may be , of course , that [the police]1725-the police will be cleverer than [I]0-i think . There are , after all , three clues . One : [the police]1725-the police are perfectly aware that [Edward Seton]119-seton was guilty . [They]1725-the police know , therefore , that [one of [the ten people on [the island]1934-the island]1825-the ten people on the island]1824-one of the ten people on the island was not [a murderer]2655-a murderer in any sense of the word , and it follows , paradoxically , that [that person]668-that person must logically be [the murderer]2488-the murderer . The second clue lies in the seventh verse of the nursery rhyme . [Armstrong]86-armstrong 's death is associated with a " red herring "[2488-the murderer] which [he]86-armstrong swallowed or rather which resulted in swallowing [him]86-armstrong ! That is to say that at that stage of the affair some hocuspocus is clearly indicated and that [Armstrong]86-armstrong was deceived by it and sent to [his]86-armstrong death . That might start a promising line of inquiry . For at that period there are only [four persons]1830-four persons and of those four [I]0-i am clearly the only one likely to inspire [him]86-armstrong with confidence . The third is symbolical . The manner of [my]0-i death marking [me]0-i on the forehead . The brand of [Cain]179-cain . There is , [I]0-i think , little more to say . After entrusting [my]0-i bottle and its message to [the sea]209-the sea [I]0-i shall go to [[my]0-i room]1988-my room and lay [myself]0-i down on the bed . To [my]0-i eyeglasses is attached what seems a length of fine black cord but it is elastic cord . [I]0-i shall lay the weight of the body on the glasses . The cord [I]0-i shall loop round the doorhandle and attach it , not too solidly , to the revolver . What [I]0-i think will happen is this : [My]0-i hand , protected with a handkerchief , will press the trigger . [My]0-i hand will fall to [my]0-i side , the revolver , pulled by the elastic will recoil to the door , jarred by the doorhandle it will detach itself from the elastic and fall . The elastic , released , will hang down innocently from the eyeglasses on which [my]0-i body is lying . A handkerchief lying on the floor will cause no comment whatever . [I]0-i shall be found , laid neatly on [my]0-i bed , shot through the forehead in accordance with the record kept by [[my]0-i fellow victims]1833-my fellow victims . Times of death can not be stated with any accuracy by the time [our]1834-our bodies are examined . When [the sea]209-the sea goes down , there will come from the mainland boats and [men]817-men . And [they]1837-they will find [ten dead bodies]1838-ten dead bodies and an unsolved problem on [Indian Island]2-indian island . Signed [[Lawrence Wargrave]118-john]1839-lawrence wargrave
